intro: Primula discolor, commonly known as the variable primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow, depending on the variety. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features basal leaves that are often hairy and slightly lobed. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a splash of color to shady garden spaces.
